text: BookPeople store at Sixth & Lamar BookPeople is an independent bookstore in Austin, Texas, and the largest bookstore in the state of Texas. It was founded in 1970 and has been voted the best bookstore by the Austin Chronicle every year since 1995 . BookPeople was voted Publishers Weekly's "Best Bookstore in the US 2005".Mutter, John. "PW's Bookseller of the Year: Steve Bercu, Book People", Publisher's Weekly, May 2, 2005. It is a member of the Austin Independent Business Alliance. It is also a member of the American Booksellers Association. == History == BookPeople's Teen Literature section BookPeople was founded in 1970 by Michael Nills and originally named Grok Books in reference to Stranger in a Strange Land by Robert A. Heinlein. The book store eventually fell into the hands of Philip Sansone, who renamed the store BookPeople in reference to Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury in 1984 when the store moved locations. ==See also== * List of companies based in Austin, Texas ==References== * Austin Chronicle ==External links== * BookPeople website homepage * Austin Independent Business Alliance Category:Independent bookstores of the United States Category:Companies based in Austin, Texas Category:Bookstores established in the 20th century Category:American companies established in 1970 Category:Retail companies established in 1970 Category:1970 establishments in Texas
